Atra Installation

Learn how to install and get started with Atra

Step 1: Download the Latest Version

Go to the GitHub Releases page and download the latest version for your operating system.

ðŸ’¡ Atra is available for Windows, macOS and Linux

Step 2: Install

Depending on your operating system:

Windows

PowerShell 
                                
                                    # Download and extract atra.exe
# Add to PATH or place in project folder

macOS/Linux

bash 
                                
                                    # Download the appropriate binary file
chmod +x atra
sudo mv atra /usr/local/bin/

Step 3: Create Your First Project

Create a new folder for your project and create a configuration file:

config.json 
                                
                                    {
  "source_folder": "src",
  "output_folder": "dist"
}

Then create a src folder and create your first index.atra file:

src/index.atra 
                                
                                    text("");

html(lang="en"){
  head(){
    title(){
      text("My First Atra Page");
    }
    @[
      body {
        font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
        margin: 2rem;
      }
    ]
  }
  body(){
    h1(){
      text("Welcome to Atra!");
    }
    p(){
      text("This is my first page created with Atra.");
    }
  }
}

Step 4: Build Your Project

Run Atra to compile your project:

terminal 
                                
                                    atra build config.json

Or use watch mode for automatic rebuilding:

terminal 
                                
                                    atra watch config.json
âœ… Your page will be generated in the 'dist' folder

Next Steps

Now that you have a working Atra installation, you can:

  • Read the documentation
  • See examples
  • Experiment with components and special functions
